formula: a(n) = 3*a(n-1) - 3*a(n-2) + 2*a(n-3) - a(n-4) (holds at least up to n = 1000 but is not known to hold in general).
mathematica: RecurrenceTable[{a[0] == 5, a[1] == 8, a[n] == Ceiling[a[n - 1]^2/a[n - 2]]}, a, {n, 0, 40}] (* _Bruno Berselli_, Feb 05 2016 *)
prog: (MAGMA) Lxy:=[5,8]; [n le 2 select Lxy[n] else Ceiling(Self(n-1)^2/Self(n-2)): n in [1..40]]; // _Bruno Berselli_, Feb 05 2016
crossrefs: See A008776 for definitions of Pisot sequences.
author: _David W. Wilson_
